page.title: 06WIMBLEBALL RESERVOIR
page.content: Wimbleball Reservoir covers 374 acres and lies 656 feet above sea level just within the Exmoor National Park, six miles north of Bampton. The wardens job is to look after the lake and a further 160 acres of land surrounding it. The whole area boasts a variety of water-based recreation such as: sailing, fishing, canoeing and rowing as well as walking, camping, horse-riding and birdwatching. The dam was started in 1974 though preliminary investigations began in 1965 and continued until 1978. It was built to create a water supply for the South West water authority and has a maximum capacity of 21,543 Megalitres or 4800 million gallons. The reservoir cost 10 million pounds to build and is designed to given an output of 4.5 thousand gallons for 600 days.
